intro: Polygala asbestina, commonly known as the asbestine milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the genus Polygala, which includes over 800 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, often clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
